title: Self-Hosted n8n Workflow Automation
brief: A secure, self-hosted n8n instance for workflow automation, accessible remotely via Cloudflare Zero Trust Tunnels.
details:
Overview: Deployed a self-hosted instance of n8n, a powerful workflow automation tool, to orchestrate custom automations and integrations without relying on third-party cloud limits.

Key Components:
  • n8n Instance: Running in a Docker container for easy management and updates.
  • Cloudflare Zero Trust: Implemented for secure remote access without exposing ports to the public internet.
  • Cloudflare Tunnels (cloudflared): Used to create a secure outbound connection from the local server to the Cloudflare edge, bypassing complex firewall rules.
  • DNS & CNAME: Configured updated namespaces and CNAME records in Cloudflare DNS to route traffic to the tunnel endpoint.

Why: To maintain full control over data privacy, reduce costs, and enable unlimited workflow executions while ensuring enterprise-grade security for remote access.

title: Personal Portfolio Website (This Site)
brief: A custom-coded personal portfolio site built from scratch to showcase my work, experience, and contact info.
details:
Technology as an Enabler: My first personal portfolio website took several months to build and had a very basic, dated appearance, with limited features and little interactivity. In contrast, this current site was developed in just two days, thanks to modern tools and frameworks. Leveraging Eleventy, Nunjucks, and custom JavaScript, I was able to quickly implement a much more engaging and interactive experience.

AI Vibe Coding: I used AI-powered vibe coding to develop this website, despite having minimal prior knowledge of JavaScript. This approach enabled rapid prototyping, troubleshooting, and feature implementation, making the development process highly efficient and accessible.

Features & Technical Aspects: The site now includes a dynamic blog page, interactive map, embedded videos, a contact form powered by Formspree, and a responsive UI with sticky sidebar navigation and collapsible panels. These enhancements were made possible by the rapid evolution of web technologies, which have dramatically reduced development time and enabled richer user experiences.

Unique Implementation Details (Most to Least Complex):
  • Cloudflare Worker Integration: Serverless proxy for fetching leadership quotes with CORS handling for secure cross-origin requests.
  • Matrix Rain Background Animation: Canvas-based animated background using requestAnimationFrame for the Labs page with falling characters and opacity fade effects.
  • Sticky Sidebar Navigation: Sidebar that remains fixed in viewport while scrolling, with automatic active link highlighting based on scroll position and JavaScript scroll event detection.
  • Collapsible Details Drawer: Expandable project cards with smooth animations that dynamically reposition based on grid layout, using CSS transitions and JavaScript event handling.
  • Dynamic Event Listeners: Vanilla JavaScript for menu toggling, tab switching, scroll detection, and DOM manipulation across multiple pages.
  • JSON-Driven Content Architecture: All project, experience, education, and specialization data loaded from JSON files, enabling easy updates without template changes.
  • Tabbed Interface: Multi-tab content panels with animated fade-in transitions, active state indicators, and keyboard-accessible tab management.
  • Responsive Grid Layout: CSS Grid with auto-fit and minmax for flexible multi-column layouts that adapt to screen size.
  • Form Integration: Formspree-powered contact form with client-side validation and server-side email delivery.
  • Custom SVG Navigation Icons: Inline SVG icons for navigation links with drop-shadow filters and dynamic color coding per page section.
  • Glowing Text Effects: Accent colors with text-shadow glow effects on hover (gold, blue, cyan, pink, orange, purple) for visual emphasis and feedback.

Tools Used: VS Code, Git, GitHub, Eleventy (11ty), Nunjucks, Formspree, Cloudflare Workers, custom CSS/JS.

Architecture: Static site generated with Eleventy, modular Nunjucks templates, global JSON data for content, assets pipeline for CSS/JS/images, deployed via GitHub Pages.

Why: I built this site to have full control over design, content, and workflow, using modern tools and best practices for maintainability and speed.

title: Capacitive Touch Panel Project
brief: A hardware and software project to design and prototype a custom capacitive touch interface.
details:
Overview: Developed a multi-zone capacitive touch panel for interactive control surfaces.

Tools & Technologies: Arduino, custom PCB design, capacitive sensing libraries, C/C++, 3D printing for enclosure, oscilloscope for signal analysis.

Architecture: Hardware: custom PCB with multiple touch pads, microcontroller for signal processing, USB interface for PC connectivity.
Software: firmware for real-time touch detection, debounce logic, event mapping to user actions.

Features: Multi-zone touch detection, adjustable sensitivity, plug-and-play USB interface, open-source firmware.

Applications: Used for custom control panels, musical instruments, and interactive installations.

Video: Interactive Touch Panel Visualization Demo

This demonstration showcases the real-time capabilities of the capacitive touch panel. The interface displays multiple interactive features:

  • Multi-Touch Detection: The top-left corner displays a square for each detected finger (up to 4 simultaneous touches), providing immediate visual feedback on touch points.
  • Coordinate Tracking (Blue Box): Activating the blue box enables the coordinate function, which precisely displays the X,Y coordinates of each touch point on the screen in real-time.
  • Touch Markers (Green Box): The green box activates a marker placement mode that displays colored dots at each touch location, using consistent color coding to identify individual fingers.
  • Line Drawing (Red Box): Similar to the marker mode, but instead of discrete dots, this mode connects touch points with lines, creating a visual trail of touch movements.
  • Binary Data Visualization: One of the most fascinating features: this mode displays the raw binary data being read directly from the touch panel controller, allowing you to literally see the 0's and 1's being transmitted by the hardware in real-time.
  • Multi-Finger Pattern: When five fingers are detected simultaneously, the interface displays a unique color pattern, demonstrating the panel's ability to handle extended multi-touch scenarios.
